note:
Name:  ___                   Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   M
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
No Known Allergies / Adverse Drug Reactions
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
Altered Mental Status, fall
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
___ - L tragus laceration repair

 
History of Present Illness:
___ yo M with Parkinsons Disease, paroxysmal AF and TIA in ___ ( 
on apixiban), chronic right frontal infarct, who presents with 
altered mental status with associated fall of unclear etiology.

At around 7 this AM, the patient vaguely recalls (and provides a 
disclaimer that he has a fair amount of uncertainty about what 
occurred) that he was walking to the bathroom, when he fell and 
hit his ear on his walker. He describes his experience as a 
"fugue" state. The next thing he knew, his ear was bleeding. His 
wife supplements that she entered the room and noticed patient 
slumped over the middle shelf of their closet (which is 5 feet 
from the bed) with bleeding from his left ear. She notes that he 
seemed confused at this point and did not know what hurt but 
also adds that in past few months patient has had increased 
psychomotor activation in general (has been getting up more 
spontaneously and walking around when not supposed to) and has 
had increased issues with memory and confusion.

At the time of his fall he does not recall feeling any chest 
palpitations, chest pain, SOB, lightheadedness, or dizziness. He 
was not nauseas, and had no vomiting. His tongue was not 
lacerated. He was able to ambulate afterwards with his walker, 
which is his baseline. He had no residual weakness, 
nausea/vomiting, or balance issues. He wears depends at baseline 
and wife is unable to confirm or deny loss of bowel or bladder 
continence.

The night before, he recalls drinking 2 partial glasses of wine 
and lots of food. In general, he feels dehydrated. He reports 
low BPs 100s/60s recently, but previously was hypertensive. His 
isradipine dose was also recently reduced from5 mg BID to 2.5 mg 
BID. He recently increased his dose of melatonin, per his 
neurologist from 5mg to 7.5 mg. His wife notes that he had 
trouble adhering to his medication list, but with the aid of his 
family members he is able to stick to them.

He notes that he has never experienced anything like this 
before. He said that the last time he fell in his bedroom was 
several years ago, and he thinks he fell during the night in a 
vivid dream. Of note, he also had 2 mechanical falls while not 
using walker this past ___. He did not hit his head, but did 
bruise his bottom. 

On review of recent neurology records, he has been having more 
difficulty with his balance in the past few months. He cannot 
shower on his own at this time without assistance. He is unsafe 
going down stairs. He has also recently retired from his 
practice due to safety concerns. His wife and son note that 
overall his camptocormia has gotten significantly worse in the 
past few months and that he "is bent down in an L-shape whenever 
he walks with his walker." He is also more confused for more of 
the day as compared to prior months.

In the ED, initial vitals:  96.0 Temp 60 HR 117/74 BP 18 RR 100% 
RA. Orthostatic vitals with BP 132/71 lying down-> 77/51 
standing (HR from 51-> 64)

Exam was notable for:laceration on L tragus but was generally 
well-appearing. Labs notable for CK 507. INR at 1.4. Otherwise 
CBC, Chem 7, UA were unconcerning. EKG normal. Non-contrast head 
CT, C-spine, CXR normal. He was found to have marked orthostasis 
while standing with physical therapy to SBP 70 as stated above. 
Patient was given 1L NS and his BP improved. He was given a 
tetanus shot, and his left tragus was repaired. He was given 
afternoon sinemet,and started on home Parkinsons meds. 

- Vitals prior to transfer:  97.9 Temp 65 HR 18 RR 141/84 BP 99% 
RA

On the floor, the patient is awake and alert now with ___ yo son 
and wife at bedside. He is fatigued, but notes this is chronic. 
He complains of no headache or neck pain. He has no fever, 
chills, CP, dyspnea, dysuria or increased urinary frequency 
(although, he does have polyuria at baseline due to his 
___. He has not had sick contacts. He feels that his 
weight continues to be low although he is trying to increase his 
p.o. intake.  He has not had diarrhea, and thinks his last BM 
was this AM.

 
Past Medical History:
Sleep disorder
Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation
Personal history of TIA (transient ischemic attack)
History of stroke
___ disease. Marked flexion posture at the waist, 
consistent with worsening camptocormia. Rest tremor of the left 
arm was noted towards the end of ___ and his diagnosis was made 
in ___.
Camptocormia
Essential hypertension
Pigmentary open-angle glaucoma of both eyes, indeterminate stage
Cataract, nuclear sclerotic, both eyes
Dry eye syndrome
Spinal stenosis of lumbar region
Peripheral edema
S/p MVC ___
 
Social History:
___
Family History:
No history of ___ disease
Maternal GM--DM
Sister- HTN
Mother - strokes,HTN
Father - arrhythmia 
 
Physical ___:
ADMISSION PHYSICAL EXAM
=====================
VITALS: Temp 98.1 PO 161/82 57 18 100% RA
GENERAL: Alert and oriented x 3.  No acute distress, Sitting up 
in bed. Conversational and interactive.
HEENT: Sclerae anicteric, MMM, oropharynx clear, EOMI, PERRL, 
neck supple, JVP not elevated, no LAD, left tragus with stitches 
and dried blood
CARDIOVASCULAR: Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 + S2, no 
murmurs, rubs, gallops , no carotid bruits, carotid pulses 2+
LUNGS: Clear to auscultation bilaterally posteriorly without 
wheezes, rales, rhonchi
ABDOMEN: Soft, non-tender, non-distended, bowel sounds present, 
no organomegaly, no rebound or guarding 
GU: No foley , no suprapubic tenderness or fullness
Back: small red open laceration 1 cm on left upper back - 
nontender, not actively bleeding
EXTREMITIES: Warm, well perfused, 2+ DP, ___, radial pulses, 
bilateral 1+ pedal edema, no cyanosis, adequate skin turgor
MSK: good muscle tone in ___
NEURO: CN ___ intact. PERRL. Biceps flexion ___, tricep 
extension ___, hip flexion ___,  plantarflexion ___, 
dorsiflexion ___. 3+ biceps, 2+ triceps, 3+ knee reflex. No 
resting tremor. Slight intention tremor,  Left > R cogwheel 
rigidity, masked facies.  FTN intact, no dysdiadokinesia - 
(although movements of right hand slowed). Gait assessment 
deferred given concern for orthostasis. 

DISCHARGE PHYSICAL EXAM
======================

GENERAL: Alert and oriented x 3.  No acute distress, Sitting up 
in bed. Conversational and interactive.
HEENT: Sclerae anicteric, MMM, oropharynx clear, EOMI, PERRL,

CARDIOVASCULAR: Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 + S2, no

LUNGS: Clear to auscultation bilaterally posteriorly without 
wheezes, rales, rhonchi
ABDOMEN: Soft, non-tender, non-distended, bowel sounds present, 
no organomegaly, no rebound or guarding 
GU: No foley , no suprapubic tenderness or fullness
Back: small indurated mass on left upper back, approximately 2cm 
in diameter. 
EXTREMITIES: Warm, well perfused, 2+ DP, ___, radial pulses, 
bilateral 1+ pedal edema, no cyanosis, adequate skin turgor
MSK: good muscle tone in ___
NEURO: CN ___ intact. No resting tremor. Slight intention 
tremor,  Left > R cogwheel rigidity, masked facies.  FTN intact, 
(although movements of right hand slowed). 
MSE: No dysarthria, No apparent word finding difficulty

IMAGING
=======
___ CT Head:
1. No evidence of acute intracranial process or hemorrhage.
2. Small area of encephalomalacia in the right frontal lobe 
consistent with chronic infarction.

___ CT C-spine:
1.  There is no evidence of cervical spine fracture or cervical 
spine
malalignment.
2.  Mild to moderate degenerative changes at C5/C6 level, 
consistent with
anterior and posterior spondylosis.

___ CXR:
No acute cardiopulmonary process.
 
Brief Hospital Course:
___ yo M with Parkinsons Disease, paroxysmal AF with TIA in ___ 
(on apixiban), chronic right frontal infarct, who presents with 
altered mental status with associated fall likely from 
orthostatic hypotension.

# Syncope
# Orthostatic hypotension
Patient presents with fall without concrete recollection of the 
events. Imaging negative for bleed. DDx includes orthostatic 
hypotension from hypovolemia vs. orthostatic hypotension from 
worsening of parkinsons disease. Unlikely mechanical fall. No 
events on tele for 24 hours to suggest cardiac arrhythmia. 
Patient was given IVF with mild improvement in orthostatic vital 
signs. He was also given ___ stockings. Physical therapy 
evaluated the patient and recommended discharge home with 24 
hour supervision or discharge to rehab. The patient does not 
have 24 hour supervision and refused to go to rehab. He was able 
to verbalize the risks of going home, and that they include him 
falling again and potentially injuring himself. He is willing to 
assume to risk of being discharged home, and refused rehab. He 
should get home ___ and ___ services. Orthostatic vital signs 
on day of discharge: 158/78 Lying, 98/61 Standing 1 min, ___ 
Standing 3 min. Patient was asymptomatic at this time. 

# Left tragus laceration
Sutured in the ED. No evidence of infection. ___ in ___ 
days with PCP for suture removal (___)

#Paraoxysmal AFib
#History of TIA in ___. 
-Continued home Apixaban 5 mg PO BID 
-Continued home Atenolol 50 mg PO DAILY 

#Parkinsons Disease.
Patient was diagnosed with PD in ___, with a rest tremor noted 
in ___. According to Atrius records, he has ongoing and 
progressive difficulty in his mobility, posture and wide based 
gait. He continued to have a marked flexion posture at the 
waist, consistent with worsening camptocormia. 
-Continued home Amantadine 100 mg PO BID 
-Continued home Rasagiline 1 mg PO DAILY 
-Continued home Carbidopa-Levodopa (___) 2 TAB PO QAM 
-Continued home Carbidopa-Levodopa (___) 2 TAB PO 11 AM 
-Continued home Carbidopa-Levodopa (___) 2 TAB PO Q DAILY AT 
1500 
-Continued home Carbidopa-Levodopa (___) 1 TAB PO Q 7PM 
-Continued home Requip XL (rOPINIRole) 12 mg oral QAM
-Continued home Requip XL (rOPINIRole) 4 mg oral QPM 

# HTN 
- Held home isradipine 2.5 mg daily.

#Neuropathy
According to Atrius records, he appears to have developed 
significant entrapment neuropathies although his nerve 
conduction study did not support a generalized neuropathy at the 
time it was done.
-Continued home Gabapentin 600 mg PO QHS 

#Glaucoma
-Continued home Dorzolamide 2% Ophth. Soln. 1 DROP BOTH EYES Q8H 

-Continued home Timolol Maleate 0.5% 1 DROP BOTH EYES QAM 
-Continued home travoprost 0.004 % ophthalmic QHS (family to 
bring from home)

TRANSITIONAL ISSUES
===================
- Discharged holding home isradipine, please consider changing 
other medications given orthostatic hypotension
- s/p repair of left tragus. Non-dissolvable stiches. Will need 
to be removed by PCP ___ ___ days (___)
- Patient should continue to work with ___

# CONTACT: ___ (wife) ___ 
# CODE STATUS:

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Dr. ___ were hospitalized at ___. 

Why did ___ come to the hospital?
=================================

What did we do for ___?
=======================
- We sutured your ear
- We stopped your isradipine
- We gave ___ stockings
- Physical therapy evaluated ___ and recommended that ___ go to 
a rehabilitation facility to get stronger before going home. 

What do ___ need to do?
=======================
- It is important that ___ with your PCP and your 
___ (appointment information below)
- Please continue to work with physical therapy and occupational 
therapy at home.
- The sutures in your left ear will need to be removed by your 
PCP at your ___ appointment on ___.

It was a pleasure caring for ___. We wish ___ the best!

Sincerely,
Your ___ Medicine Team

qafib.question: Does the note describe the patient as having permanent, paroxysmal, or persistent afib?

qprior_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having a stroke or transient ischemic attack?

qarterial_hypertension.question: Does the note describe the patient as having arterial hypertension on treatment (high bp e.g. >140, or HTN)?

qt2d.question: Does the note describe the patient as having Diabetes mellitus (DM1, DM2, T2D, T1DM, T2DM)?

qheart_failure.question: Does the note describe the patient as having heart failure?

qsurgical_valvular_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having valvular disease requiring surgery (stenosis)?

qafib_ablation.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a planned or past ablation procedure for afib?

qbleeding.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a serious bleeding in the past 6 months?

qpeptic_ulcer_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having peptic ulcer disease?

qrecent_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a stroke during this admission or within the last month? (Answer yes for any recent stroke if the date is unclear)

qhemorrhagic.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having any hemorrhagic tendencies or blood dyscrasias?

qbipolar.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with bipolar disorder?

qschizophrenia.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with schizophrenia or any schizoaffective disorders?

qmdd.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with depression or major depressive disorder (MDD)?

qmed_decisions.question: Does the note describe the patient as being unable to make medical decisions? (Answer no unless there is evidence the patient cannot make their own medical decisions).

qchads2.question: What is the highest CHADS2 score mentioned? Answer "NA" if no CHADS2 score is in the note.

qblood_glucose.question: What is the highest blood glucose lab mentioned? Answer "NA" if no blood glucose score is in the note.

qlvef.question: What is the lowest left ventricular ejection (LVEF, ef, ejection fraction) fraction mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no LVEF is in the note, Answer 55 if the lowest value is 55% or greater.

qPLT.question: What is the lowest platelet count (PLT) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no platelet count is available in the note.

qHGB.question: What is the lowest hemoglobin (HGB) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no HGB value is available in the note.

qCREAT.question: What is the higest serum creatinine (Creat) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no creatinine value is available in the note.

qAST.question: What is the higest aspartate aminotransferase level (AST) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no AST value is available in the note.

qBILI.question: What is the higest total bilirubin (TotBili, Bili) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no bilirubin value is available in the note.
